dct_title_s: Route of the South African Gold Fields Exploration Company's expedition 1869 to 1872 (and previous tracks)
dct_description_sm: The map, which shows the route and previous tracks in red, covers the Eastern Cape, Orange Free State, Natal, Transvaal, Southern Rhodesia and Northern Rhodesia. Features and relief such as rivers, valleys and mountains as well as towns are indicated.
Detailed annotations regarding the people en route as well as notes on topographical conditions and on earlier expeditions.
Coordinates approximate and based on Greenwich meridian.
dct_rights_sm: Image courtesy University of Cape Town Libraries, Special Collections: Maps scanned under the William and Yvonne Jacobson Digital Africana Program at UCT. If you have questions, please contact David Rumsey Map Center at rumseymapcenter@stanford.edu.
